alert.note: Alert for East Carroll; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 11:21AM CDT until March 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN EAST CARROLL...NORTH CENTRAL TENSAS AND EASTERN MADISON PARISHES...CENTRAL WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN ISSAQUENA COUNTIES... At 1121 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alsatia to 6 miles southeast of Mansford to 7 miles southeast of Afton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Eagle Bend around 1130 AM CDT. Vicksburg around 1135 AM CDT. Redwood around 1140 AM CDT. Bovina around 1155 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Mound, Delta and Richmond. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for west central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
